description.narrative: Improve the enabling environment for peace and social cohesion in Iraq through a multi-pronged intervention

activity-description.narrative: Establishment/strengthening of Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion
Establishment/strengthening of Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion
Establishment/strengthening of Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion
Establishment/strengthening of Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1 Policy and institutional frameworks for peace and social cohesion strengthened
1.1 # of government policy and planning actions on peace and social cohesion supported by UNDP 1.2 # of government officials reached through capacity-development actions on peace and social cohesion disaggregated by gender, institution type and location 1.3 % of sampled government officials reached through capacity-development actions reporting increased knowledge and skills, disaggregated by gender, institution type and location 1.4 National coordination structure is operational with UNDP support 1.5 Sub-national coordination structures are operational in up to 4 governorates with UNDP support
Output 2 Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion strengthened
2.1 # of LPCs functional with UNDP support, disaggregated by location 2.2 # of LPC, Women’s Groups, Youth Groups and CBO members completing function specific training on agreed curricular, disaggregated by topic, group type and gender. 2.3 % of sampled training participants reached reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by topic/course, group type and gender 2.4 # of persons reached through community listening exercises, disaggregated by gender and location 2.5 # of youth-led and women-led actions to address community social cohesion supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location
Output 3: Iraqi institutions have increased capacities for promoting peace and social cohesion through education and research
3.1 Diploma programmes on Peace Education offered in upto 6 Iraqi universities supported by UNDP 3.2 # of graduating diploma and masters students from programmes supported by UNDP, disaggregated by university location, programme type and gender 3.3 # of CSO members completing conflict analysis capacity development modules supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location and gender 3.4 # and descriptions of instances in which training concepts were applie

comment.narrative:
Output 1 Policy and institutional frameworks for peace and social cohesion strengthened
1.1 0 government policy and planning actions on peace and social cohesion supported by UNDP (2019) 1.2 0 government officials reached through capacity-development actions on peace and social cohesion disaggregated by gender, institution type and location (2019) 1.3 0% sampled government officials reached through capacity-development actions reporting increased knowledge and skills, disaggregated by gender, institution type and location (2019) 1.4 No National structure is operational with UNDP support (2019) 1.5 Protection Working Group in Ninewa is operational (2019)
Output 2 Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion strengthened 2.1 31 LPCs are established (2018) 2.2 0 LPC, Women’s Groups, Youth Groups and CBO members completing function specific training on agreed curricular, disaggregated by topic, group type and gender (2019) 2.3 0% sampled training participants reached reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by topic/course, group type and gender (2019) 2.4 0 people reached through community listening exercises, disaggregated by gender and location (2019) 2.5 0 youth-led and women-led actions to address community social cohesion supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location (2019)
Output 3: Iraqi institutions have increased capacities for promoting peace and social cohesion through education and research
3.1 3 universities offering diploma programmes on Peace Education (2019) 3.2 0 graduating diploma and masters students from programmes supported by UNDP, disaggregated by university location, programme type and gender (2019) 3.3 0 CSO members completing conflict analysis capacity development modules supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location and gender (2019) 3.4 0 instances in which training concepts were applied as reported by CSO members (2019) 3.5 No peace and social cohesion measurement tool in

Output 1 Policy and institutional frameworks for peace and social cohesion strengthened
1.1: 5 government gender sensitive policy and actions plans on peace and social cohesion and PVE supported by UNDP 1.2: 50 government officials reached through capacity-development actions on peace and social cohesion disaggregated by gender, institution type and location 1.3: 85% sampled government officials reached through capacity-development actions reporting increased knowledge and skills, disaggregated by gender, institution type and location 1.4: National coordination structure is operational with UNDP support 1.5: 0 Sub-national coordination structures are operational in up to 4 governorates with UNDP support
Output 2 Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion strengthened
2.1: 20 LPCs functional with UNDP support, disaggregated by location 2.2: 50 LPCs, Women’s Groups, Youth Groups and CBO members completing function specific training on agreed curricular, disaggregated by topic, group type and gender. 2.3: 70% of sampled training participants reached reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by topic/course, group type and gender 2.4 200 families of IDPs perceived as affiliated with ISIL accepted by communities for reintegration 2.5: 20 youth-led and women-led actions to address community social cohesion supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location
Output 3 Iraqi institutions have increased capacities for promoting peace and social cohesion through education and research
3.1: 3 Diploma programmes on Peace Education offered in upto 6 Iraqi universities supported by UNDP 3.2 1 school of democracy is established 3.3: 45 graduating diploma and masters students from programmes supported by UNDP, disaggregated by university location, programme type and gender 3.4: 20 CSOs trained and engaged Social Cohesion in PVE activities 3.5: 0 descriptions of instances in which training concepts were applied as reported by CSO members 3.6: Peace and social cohesion measurement tool designed
Output 4 Increased positive relationships and understanding between and among different groups and communities in Iraq
4.1: 30 media personnel reached through capacity-development, disaggregated by organization type and gender 4.2 0 people engaged in social media and Iraqi food culture 4.3 0 social media survey conducted 4.4 0 consultation and 0 FGDs held 4.5 0 policy paper and recommendations produced 4.6: 0 sample participating media personnel reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by institution type and gender. 4.7: 0 new ‘positive’ stories published by target media during the project, disaggregated by medium 4.8: 70 trained religious leaders demonstrating improved knowledge of social cohesion PVE concepts. 4.9: 60% of those sampled reporting increased opportunities for interaction with other groups as a result of UNDP interventions, disaggregated by group type, gender and location 4.10: 65% of those sampled reporting increased trust of the other group as a result of UNDP interventions disaggregated by group type, gender and location
Output 5 Improved conflict sensitivity and social cohesion responsiveness in governance, stabilization and development interventions
5.1: 2 national and governorate level gender sensitive conflict analysis and studies facilitated, and findings shared 5.2: 10 descriptions of instances in which training concepts were applied as reported by UNDP personnel disaggregated by project and gender 5.3: 6 UNDP partners reached through conflict sensitivity training disaggregated by organization and gender 5.4: 0% of UNDP partners reached who are satisfied with capacity development initiatives, disaggregated by organization and gender

Output 1 Policy and institutional frameworks for peace and social cohesion strengthened
1.1: 0 Policy/Planning Actions supported (i.e. the National strategy on Local Peace Committees) 1.2: 0 government officials reached through capacity-development actions on peace and social cohesion disaggregated by gender, institution type and location 1.3: 0% sampled government officials reached through capacity-development actions reporting increased knowledge and skills, disaggregated by gender, institution type and location 1.4: Committee for Dialogue and Societal Peace structure continues to receive UNDP support 1.5: 0 Sub-national coordination structures are operational in up to 4 governorates with UNDP support
Output 2 Local and community mechanisms and resources for peace and social cohesion strengthened
2.1: 21 LPCs (13 Anbar, 4 Salah al Din, 7 Ninewa) are functional and supported and 4 CDCs (2 Diyala, 2 Kirkuk) are established. 2.2: 21 LPCs and 5 Women’s Groups, 5 Youth Groups and CBO members completing function specific training on agreed curricular through the social cohesion programme. 2.3: TBD of sampled training participants reached reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by topic/course, group type and gender 2.4: 0 persons reached through community listening exercises, disaggregated by gender and location 2.5: 25 youth-led and women-led actions to address community social cohesion supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location
Output 3 Iraqi institutions have increased capacities for promoting peace and social cohesion through education and research
3.1: 0 Diploma programmes on Peace Education offered in up to 6 Iraqi universities supported by UNDP 3.2: 0 graduating diploma and masters students from programmes supported by UNDP, disaggregated by university location, programme type and gender 3.3: 0 CSO members completing conflict analysis capacity development modules supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location and gender 3.4: 0 descriptions of instances in which training concepts were applied as reported by CSO members 3.5: Peace and social cohesion measurement tool not yet designed
Output 4 Increased positive relationships and understanding between and among different groups and communities in Iraq
4.1: 124 media personnel (60 women) reached through capacity-development, disaggregated by organization type and gender 4.2: 0 sample participating media personnel reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by institution type and gender. 4.3: 0 new ‘positive’ stories published by target media during the project, disaggregated by medium 4.4: 24 trained religious leaders demonstrating improved knowledge of social cohesion PVE concepts. 4.5: 0% of those sampled reporting increased opportunities for interaction with other groups as a result of UNDP interventions, disaggregated by group type, gender and location 4.6: 0% of those sampled reporting increased trust of the other group as a result of UNDP interventions disaggregated by group type, gender and location
Output 5 Improved conflict sensitivity and social cohesion responsiveness in governance, stabilization and development interventions
5.1: 0 Governorate level conflict analysis facilitated and findings shared 5.2: 0 UNDP personnel reached through conflict sensitivity training disaggregated by project and gender 5.3: 0 descriptions of instances in which training concepts were applied as reported by UNDP personnel disaggregated by project and gender 5.4: 0 UNDP partners reached through conflict sensitivity training disaggregated by organization and gender 5.5: 0% of UNDP partners reached who are satisfied with capacity development initiatives, disaggregated by organization and gender

2.1: 20 LPCs functional with UNDP support, disaggregated by location 2.2: 100 LPCs, Women’s Groups, Youth Groups and CBO members completing function specific training on agreed curricular, disaggregated by topic, group type and gender. 2.3: 75% of sampled training participants reached reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by topic/course, group type and gender 2.4 200 families of IDPs perceived as affiliated with ISIL accepted by communities for reintegration 2.5: 20 youth-led and women-led actions to address community social cohesion supported by UNDP, disaggregated by location

4.1: 30 media personnel reached through capacity-development, disaggregated by organization type and gender 4.2 1000 people engaged in social media and Iraqi food culture 4.3 1 social media survey conducted 4.4 1 consultation and 38 FGDs held 4.5 1 policy paper and recommendations produced 4.6: 75% sample participating media personnel reporting increased knowledge and skills following training, disaggregated by institution type and gender. 4.7: 0 new ‘positive’ stories published by target media during the project, disaggregated by medium 4.8: 70 trained religious leaders demonstrating improved knowledge of social cohesion PVE concepts. 4.9: 70% of those sampled reporting increased opportunities for interaction with other groups as a result of UNDP interventions, disaggregated by group type, gender and location 4.10: 65% of those sampled reporting increased trust of the other group as a result of UNDP interventions disaggregated by group type, gender and location

5.1: 1 updated PEA is developed and shared in addition to 2 governorate level gender conflict analysis 5.2: 10 descriptions of instances in which training concepts were applied as reported by UNDP personnel disaggregated by project and gender 5.3: 15 UNDP partners reached through conflict sensitivity training disaggregated by organization and gender 5.4: 80% of UNDP partners reached who are satisfied with capacity development initiatives, disaggregated by organization and gender
